explosives.rationale: Not classified as "Explosives" with its oxygen budget calculated at -218, though being a nitroso compound containing chemical groups with explosive properties

flammable_gases.rationale: Classified as "solid" according to GHS definition

oxidizing_gases.rationale: Classified as "solid" according to GHS definition

gases_under_pressure.rationale: Classified as "solid" according to GHS definition

flammable_liquids.rationale: Classified as "solid" according to GHS definition

flammable_solids.rationale: Classification not possible due to lack of data, though classified as "flammable" by ICSC (2003)

self_reactive_substances.rationale: Classification not possible due to lack of data, though being a nitroso compound containing chemical groups with explosive properties and decomposition energy of 0.65kJ/g at temperatures of 300-500degC (Bretherick (J) (5th, 1998)).

pyrophoric_liquids.rationale: Classified as "solid" according to GHS definition

self_heating_substances.rationale: Test methods applicable to liquid substances are not available (melting point: 66.5degC (ICSC, 2003), test temperature: 140degC).

substances_mixtures_emit_flammable_gas_i.hazard_name: Substances and mixtures which, in contact with water, emit flammable gases
substances_mixtures_emit_flammable_gas_i.rationale: Containing no metals or metalloids (B, Si, P, Ge, As, Se, Sn, Sb, Te, Bi, Po, At)

oxidizing_liquids.rationale: Classified as "solid" according to GHS definition

oxidizing_solids.rationale: Classification not possible due to lack of data, though being organic compounds containing oxygen bound to elements other than carbon and hydrogen

corrosive_to_metals.rationale: Test methods applicable to solid substances are not available.

acute_toxicity_oral.rationale: Based on the LD50 value of 1,650mg/kg calculated from the testing data of rat LD50 (oral route) of 1,650mg/kg (CERI Hazard Data 2001-32 (2002)), 3,000mg/kg (ATSDR (1993)) and 1,825mg/kg (MOE Risk Assessment vol. 3 (2004)).

acute_toxicity_dermal.rationale: Based on the rabbit LD50 (dermal route) of 7,940mg/kg (CERI Hazard Data 2001-32 (2002)).

acute_toxicity_inhalation_gas.rationale: Due to the fact that the substance is "solid" according to the GHS definition and inhalation of its gas is not expected.

skin_corrosion_irritation.rationale: Based on the description in the report on animal skin irritation tests (some details missing such as exposure duration) (ATSDR (1993)): "The substance produces irritation of the skin" (though the severity of the effects is unknown). Although classified as Category 2-3, the substance should be placed in Category 2 from the viewpoint of safety.

serious_eye_damage_irritation.rationale: Based on the description in the report on rabbit eye irritation tests (CERI Hazard Data 2001-32 (2002)): "mild irritation."

carcinogenicity.rationale: Based on the absence of data on multi-generation mutagenicity tests and germ cell mutagenicity tests in vivo, and negative data on somatic cell mutagenicity tests in vivo (micronucleus tests), described in ATSDR (1993), PATTY (4th, 1999), CERI Hazard Data 2001-32 (2002) and NTP DB (Access on Feb., 2006).

toxic_to_reproduction.rationale: Due to the fact that the substance is classified as Category B2 by EPA (1993).

systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.hazard_name: Specific target organ toxicity - Single exposure
systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.hazard_statement: May cause damage to organs (systemic toxicity)
systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.rationale: Based on the evidence from animal studies including "decreased food consumption, reduced locomotor activity, debility, tremor and collapse" (CERI Hazard Data 2001-32 (2002)). The effects on experimental animals were observed at dosing levels within the guidance value ranges for Category 2.

aspiration_hazard.hazard_name: Specific target organ toxicity - Repeated exposure
aspiration_hazard.hazard_statement: May cause damage to organs through prolonged or repeated exposure (respiratory system, liver, kidney)
aspiration_hazard.rationale: Based on the evidence from animal studies including "bronchial pneumonia and pulmonary emphysema, fatty/granular degeneration of the liver, cloudy swelling of the kidney" (MOE Risk Assessment vol. 4 (2005)). The effects on experimental animals were observed at dosing levels within the guidance value ranges for Category 2 (respiratory organs, liver, kidneys).

acute_aquatic_toxicity.rationale: It was classified into Category 2 from 96 hours LC50=5800microg/L of the fish (Bluegill) (MOE Risk Assessment vol. 2, 2003).

chronic_aquatic_toxicity.hazard_statement: Toxic to aquatic life with long lasting effects
chronic_aquatic_toxicity.rationale: Although acute toxicity was Category 2 and the bio-accumulation potential was low (BCF=42(Existing Chemical Safety Inspections Data)), since there was no rapidly degrading (the decomposition by BOD: 0%(Existing Chemical Safety Inspections Data)), it was classified into Category 2.
